snippet: After the campaign finance scandal of the city comptroller, John C. Liu, came to light, community groups sought help so that voters would not be discouraged.
abstract: New York City Campaign Finance Board director Daniel Cho, concerned about the dampening effect that fund-raising scandal involving Comptroller John C Liu could have on Asian-American voters, leads workshop on the dos and don'ts of campaign finance; session is held at the request of the Asian American Civic Alliance, a coalition of community groups formed after Liu's woes came to light.
lead_paragraph: After the campaign finance scandal of the city comptroller, John C. Liu, came to light, community groups sought help so that voters would not be discouraged.

headline.seo: For an Asian-American Audience, Lessons on Campaign Finance
headline.main: Campaign Finance Lessons for Disillusioned Asian-American Group
headline.print_headline: Campaign Finance Lessons for Disillusioned Asian-American Group
